result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Gerardo Dominguez was found guilty of OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Huber with standard release conditions, commencing FORTHWITH.
To be served in the State Prison System.
Apply 18 days sentence credit.
Concurrent with: Case 16CF238.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Defendant has completed a Victim Impact Panel.

Court orders the weapon seized is hereby forfeited and to be disposed of pursuant to statute.

Defendant Gerardo  Dominguez in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 2.
Count 1 is dismissed as a read in.
Count 3 is dismissed by operation of law.
Defendant's sister presented a statement to the court.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.


Court orders the following:
120 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions) - FORTHWITH.
18 Days Credit.
Defendant remanded to the custody of the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department.
Concurrent to:  16CF238.
To be served in the State Prison System.

FINE: $ 3,064
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to Waukesha County Sheriff's Department.
Apply Bail - Balance to be paid from the bail monies on 16CF238.

36 Months D/L REVOCATION:
36 Months IGNITION INTERLOCK: 

Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel on:  Already Attended.

Other:  AODA ASSESSMENT AND FOLLOW THROUGH.

Court orders the weapon seized is hereby forfeited and to be disposed of pursuant to statute.
Court also grants the half-price ignition interlock.
